column4: Hey guys, ive installed 9.10 and sofar its ok... however, my 8768 soundcard gets recognized as a 8738, and now i have no optical out support. Can anyone help me change the driver?
uhm
no, C-Media
if you run: sudo lshw -C sound    it will show you what it is
not something ive used, maybe if you search for the product line in the output it will yield some guides
it only matters what Linux sees it as
yes i understand that, ubuntu recognized it as a 8738 but that card/driver doesnt have optical out support. the 8768 i have does, and i need it ;)
then you will need to blacklist the driver causing issues and add the other driver
How do i figure out the name to blacklist it?
lsmod   will list the loaded modules, one will be for the sound
i blacklisted it and rebooted but now it doesnt find a card at all
only the damn hdmi sound
thats because you havent put in a replacement driver yet

maybe the system has the driver: if you type: sudo modprobe       then type a few characters from the module you blacklisted and press tab, you may find a similar named module (but with the different name) that you need
ok, but the module i blacklisted wasnt really a specific one, it was snd_cmipci
i see, well you may need to load in a specially named one, you may even need to compile or install a package from ppa
you need to websearch the sound chip you have to see what module it need
maybe the card manufacturers have open drivers
I found on the internet that cmipci is the driver for 8338/8768/8768, so its right module but somehow it selects the first one, and not the 3rd one (that i have
cmipci is the module i blacklisted
ok then unblacklist the module, maybe it needs some options on the probe
Thanks for the help earlier, turned out the option Digital Stereo' worked for 5.1 too ;) Unfortunatly i want to run XBMC and it needs 9.04.. and card is not supported there, only analog
nice
